_header: When that the Knight had thus his tale I-told
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Knight-Miller link in the Canterbury Tales — 78 lines in rhyming couplets

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Whan that the knyght had thus his tale toldin al the companye nas
                    ther yonge ne olde…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…avisith yow put me out of blameand eke men shulle not make
                    ernest of game
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next folwith the Millers prolog (f. 47); the Millers prolog
                    (RT); Here endith the Millers prolog… (f. 48)

BodBar20.First Lines:
Whan that þe knyȝt hath þus his tale toldIn alle
                    þat Cumpanye nas þer ȝong ne old…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…Auyseth ȝow & put me out of blameAnd eke men shal
                    not make ernyst of game
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
Here begynnyth þe prolog of þe Myller (f. 32v);
                        prologus (RT)

Bod414.First Lines:
[W]han þat the knight had þus his tale toldIn al the
                    cumpany nas þer yong ne old…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…Auisith you and putte me out of blameAnd eke men shuld not
                    make ernest of game
Bod414.Attributed Title: Here begynneth the prolog of the Millere (f. 37v)

Bod686.First Lines:
Whan þat the knight hadde þis his tale toldeIn al þe
                    companye nas þer yonge ne olde…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Avyseth you and put me out of blameAnd eek men shal not make
                    ernest of game
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Hic incipit prohemium fabule molendinarij (f. 40); Millere
                    (RT)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
Whan þat þe kniȝt had þus his tale toldeIn al
                    þe rowte nas þere yong ne olde…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…Aviseth you and put me oute of blameAnd eke men shuld make
                    non ernest of game
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
…and beginneth / þe prolog of þe Miller is tale (f. 36,
                    margin); The prolog of the Miller (RT); Here endeth the prolog of the Millers
                    tale… (f. 37)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
What þat the knight had thus his tale toldeIn al the companye
                    ne was þer yong ne olde…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…Auyse you and put me out of blameAnd eeke men shal not make
                    ernest of game
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
…Here begynnth the prolog of the Millere (f. 48v); the
                    prolog (RT); Here endeþ þe prolog… (f. 46v)

BodLauMis739.First Lines:
[W]han that the knyght thus his tale toldIn all the company was
                    ther yong ne olde…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…Avyse ȝow and put me out of blameAnd eke men shall not
                    make ernest of game

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:
When the knyght his tale had toldeIn al company was ther yong ne
                    olde…
BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:
…Auyseth you & putteth me out of blameAnd eke men shulde
                    not make ernest of game
BodRawPoe141.Attributed Title:
Here bigynneth the Mullers tale (f. 9v, introducing the
                        Prologue); The Muller (RT)

BodRawPoe149.First Lines:
Whan that the knyght had thus his tale y toldeIn alle the rowte nas
                    there yonge ne olde…
BodRawPoe149.Last Lines:
…and saide abide Robyn abide leue brotherSome better man shall
                    tell vs first another…
BodRawPoe149.Attributed Title: Prolog of the Miller (f. 19v, margin); the Miller (RT)

BodRawPoe223.First Lines:
Whan that the knight had thus his tale ItoldeIn al the company nas
                    ther yong ne olde…
BodRawPoe223.Last Lines:
…Auiseth you and put me out of blameAnd eke men shal not make
                    ernest of game
BodRawPoe223.Attributed Title:
Here beginneth the prolog of the Millere (f. 43); Here is ended the Prolog
                    of the Meller (f. 44)

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
WWhan that the knyght had thus his tale y toldeIn alle the
                    compaignye nas there yong ne olde…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:
…Auyseth yow and put me out of blameAnd eke men shal nat make
                    ernest of game
OxfChrCh152.Note:
I.3155-6 omitted. In addition to the lombard initial ‘W᾿,
                    there is also a ‘W᾿ in the text.
OxfChrCh152.Attributed Title: …Here bigynnyth the prohemye of the Milleris tale (f. 42)

OxfCCC198.First Lines:
Whan þat þe knight had þus his tale y toldIn all

OxfCCC198.Last Lines:

Whanne þat the knyȝt had þus his tale toldIn al

OxfTri49.First Lines:
Whenne that the knyght hath thus thys tale I toldeIn al the route
                    nas ther yong ne olde…
OxfTri49.Last Lines:
…auisith you I put me out of blameand eke men schal nat make
                    ernest of game

CULDd424.First Lines:
WHan that the knyght had his tale I toldIn al the companye ne was
                    þere ȝong ne old…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…A vyseth ȝow and put me ouȝt of blameAnd eke men
                    shuln nat make ernest of game
CULDd424.Attributed Title: The Prologe of the Millere (margin, f. 39)

CULGg427.First Lines:
SO when þe knyght hath þus hese tale toldIn al þe
                    route nas þere ȝyng ne old…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…Avyseth ȝow put me out of blameAnd ek men schal not
                    makyn ernest of game

CULIi326.First Lines:
Whenne the knyght hadde thus his tale toldeIn all the route nas
                    there yonge ne olde…
CULIi326.Last Lines:
…Avise you I put me oute of blameAnd men shall make ernest of
                    game

CamFitzMc181.First Lines:
[W]Han that the knyght his tale hath toldeIn all the company nas
                    ther yonge ne old…
CamFitzMc181.Last Lines:
…But the myller ys a cherle & þe Reve alsoffor
                    harlotry þey told both two

CamTCC582.First Lines:

                    nas young nor olde…
CamTCC582.Last Lines:
…Auiseth you and put me out of blameAnd eke men shal nat make
                    ernest of game

BLAdd35286.First Lines:

                    noght make ernest of game

BLEge2863.First Lines:
Whan þat þe knight had þus his tale toldIn all the
                    compnay nas þere ȝong ne old…
BLEge2863.Last Lines:
…And nameliche þe gentiles euerichonOure oost lowh and
                    swore so mote I gon…
BLEge2863.Attributed Title:
…And here by gynneth þe prolog of þe Millere (f.
                        24v)

BLEge2864.First Lines:
[W]Han that the knyht had thus the tale toldeIn al the route nas
                    ther yong ne olde…
BLEge2864.Last Lines:
…A viseth yow and puttith me out of blameAnd eek men shal nat
                    make ernest of game
BLEge2864.Attributed Title:
Incipit prohemium Molendinarij / Prologus Molendinarij (f.
                        46v); prologe of the Miller (RT); Explicit prologus
                    (margin f. 47v)

BLHar1758.First Lines:
Whan that the knyght had thus his tale toldeIn all the companye nas
                    ther yong ne olde…
BLHar1758.Last Lines:
…Ther ben full gode wyues mony oonWhy arte thou angry with my
                    tale now

BLHar7333.First Lines:
Whan þat þe knyght had þus his tale etoldIn al
                    þe companye nas þer yong nor old…
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
…Avyseþe yowe and put me owte of blameAnd eke men shalle
                    not maken eornste of game
BLHar7333.Attributed Title:
…and nexste / here folowynge be gynnithe here þe prologe of /
                    the Milners tale (f. 53va); Loo nowe here eondiþe þe
                    prologg of þe / milneris tale (f. 54ra)

                    cumpany nas ther yong ne old…

…Aviseth you and putte me out of blameAnd eke men shuld not
                    make ernest of game
